definitions.definition: a piece of soft paper, used especially as a handkerchief

examples.text: He wiped his nose on a tissue.
She grabbed a wad of tissues from the box and soaked up the spilt juice.

definitions.definition: a collection of cells that form the different parts of humans, animals and plants

examples.text: Dyes were extracted by boiling the plant tissue.
She treats skin and soft tissue injuries in casualty.
Vitamin C helps maintain healthy connective tissue.

definitions.definition: very thin paper used for wrapping and packing things that break easily
a story, an excuse, etc. that is full of lies

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French tissu ‘woven’, past participle of tistre, from Latin texere ‘to weave’. The word originally denoted a rich material, often interwoven with gold or silver threads, later (mid 16th cent.) any woven fabric, hence the sense of ‘intricacy’.
